text: - Rossum AI is an AI company

that does intelligent
document processing, IDP.

Rossum tries to help enterprises
optimize their businesses
by employing people more meaningfully,
not having all the people to do their toil

and input all the data
manually into the system.

We are trying to automate
document processing
to minimize human intervention.

We help automating that all,
bringing AI into the pipe.

We've been using Amazon
Web Services since day one,

and we have been using it for
the generative AI as well.
AWS brings the right trade off
between pricing and flexibility for us.
I think that's the ultimate goal there.

To be able to implement this
custom code customizations,

we've chosen AWS Lambda
as the runtime platform.
AWS Lambda brings security,
privacy, and tenant isolation

into the naturally multi-tenant
solution we provide.

We chose AWS because it
was the obvious choice
out of the platforms available.

Out of the cloud vendors
that are available,
it was the most known among our engineers,
so it was a natural choice for us.
AWS is the industry standard.

It was the first movers in
the industry of cloud, right?

So it came, I don't
know what was the year,
but it's been ages since AWS is here,
so people are used to it,
and all the newer players that,

like the new cloud vendors
are just not that common.
There is the availability,

like ubiquitous
availability of the services
is paramount for the business, right?

If AWS doesn't work,
nothing works in the world
because today's world is all internet.
(thoughtful music)
